info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 14 at 2:45PM CST until February 15 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Windy, warm, and dry conditions expected Tuesday... .An approaching strong upper level storm system will result in a area of surface low pressure developing in the lee of the Rockies throughout Tuesday. Strong south winds will quickly develop Tuesday morning and continue through Tuesday night. Very warm temperatures and dry air across portions of Oklahoma and northern Texas will combine with these winds to produce near critical to critical fire weather conditions during the afternoon and early evening hours. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7 PM CST TUESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS...WARM TEMPERATURES AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN THIRD OF OKLAHOMA... * TIMING...Tuesday afternoon and evening. * WINDS...South 20 to 25 mph with gusts over 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...12 to 20 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 70s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that start will be difficult to contain.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures will contribute to extreme fire behavior.
